comprehensive_overview: SignalP 6.0 predicts the presence and location of signal peptide cleavage sites in amino acid sequences from different organisms such as Gram-positive bacteria, Gram-negative bacteria, archae, eukaryotes, and viruses. It contains several algorithms for discriminating signal peptides from transmembrane regions.
core_features: Predicts signal peptide cleavage sites in amino acid sequences
Differentiates signal peptides from transmembrane regions
Available for various organisms including bacteria, archae, eukaryotes, and viruses
